title: Conditional Execution in AskUI Workflows
excerpt: This blog post explains how to implement preconditions in AskUl workflows, so they become manageable and stable.
content:
NOT focus solely on the Especially when you automate User Interfaces (UI) you have to deal with elements that only sometimes appear in special cases, pop-ups that jump in your face and block access to other elements. Or the workflow has some inherent variance you need to account for.

This blog post explains how to implement preconditions, so your workflows become managable and stable.

The Example

AskUI Practice Page start in light theme.

Depending on the theme that is currently active the text of the button changes between Switch to Light.

Step 1: Check for an Element to Exist

Light-theme by trying to get() the text-element Switch to Dark. get() will always return an array. And if the element was found it will have at least one element in it, if not the array is empty (Now we can check if we can safely click the switch button by verifying the array is not empty:

Step2: Also Check for Other Variant



Then we add an else if to the check for the light theme. So depending on the existence of Switch to Dark or Switch to Light the button is clicked and the theme is switched in any case:
Step 3: Encapsulate Code into a Function



Running the workflow two times in a row, so it clicks on the switch theme button twice.
Conclusion



happy path. You can use this technique to automate preconditions that need to be fulfilled for a workflow to run successfully.
author: Johannes Dienst
